page.title: 06Churches _ King's Worthy.
page.content: The earliest record of{St.Mary's {church, King's Worthy}was 800 years ago. The church has been expanded and remodelled many times since then. The tower is 15th century.Today, sadly ,it is in danger of collapsing and villagers are finding ways of raising money for restoration, such as Fetes, Flower Festivals and Jazz Bands playing for special evening services. {St. Swithuns Church, at Headbourne {Worthy}is linked with St.Marys, sharing the same vicar although it has its own Church Wardens.This is a small Saxon church, surrounded by fields and a small stream. However it is still in active use having one service every Sunday and joining with St. Mary's for many activities.
